| The total 77 1/2+1/8 | the slave-girls dînâr 12 1/12
| thereof:
In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful!
Kümmere Dich darum, worauf Du Dich mit ʿAbd ar-Raḥmān b. Ḥabīb einigen kannst. ... Try to learn upon what ʿAbd ar-Raḥmân b. Ḥabîb has agreed with him, nobody knows it, and also what he owes of maintenance. And buy for us
a velvet turban, a (dinner) napkin for the table and a triangular handkerchief for the face; and deliver to the messenger Abû Ṭâlib two dînârs,
correctly counted out, and take from him the "kitâb ar-rabûn" (treatise on mortgages) and the kitâb Dhu'l-Qarnain (the romance of Alexander). Pay them both cash down as soon as he sends them with thee. ... Sende mir die beiden (Bücher) oder bringe sie (persönlich) vorbei!
〚And buy for us green sewing silk for two carats〛, and buy for us hundred sheets of paper and starch for an eighth of a dînâr
and sugar for half (a dînâr) and an apron for the bath, good salt, three flat fayence-platters, two Caliph-cups,
a large bottle of the so-called Qatarmîz kind, fifty quinces, if they are ripe, please God.
[ | In] the name of God, the One!
